thread.title: Pakistani fishermen locked in Yemen jail return home after a decade
thread.title_full: Pakistani fishermen locked in Yemen jail return home after a decade

title: Pakistani fishermen locked in Yemen jail return home after a decade

organizations.name: foreign office and international committee of the red cross

text:
Pakistani fishermen locked in Yemen jail return home after a decade | Iran releases 18 Pakistani fishermen 
ISLAMABAD: Seven fishermen, stranded in Yemen for almost a decade, returned home to their families on Friday. 
10 years ago, fishermen from Karachi and Balochistan coastline went out fishing, but lost their way. Unable to return, they found themselves in international waters, from where they were taken into custody and locked in the central jail of Yemenâ€™s capital Sana'a. 
However, following tireless efforts of the Foreign Office and International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC), the nearly-hopeless men arrived in Islamabad after ages. 
Fishermen greeted and hugged by their loving families in Islamabad 

They were greeted at the airport by their loving families, whom they missed dearly over this 10-year period of no communication. Foreign Office and ICRC representatives accompanied the welcoming group. 0 0 Pakistani fishermen locked in Yemen jail return home after a decade   Fishermen Stranded, Fishing, Geo, Geo News, International Waters, Pakistani Fishermen, Pakistani Fishermen In Yemen, Pakistani Fishermen Return, Pakistani Fishermen Return, Balochistan, Central Jail Sana'a, Islamabad, Islamabad Airport, Karachi, Sana'a, Yemen, Foreign Office, Icrc, International Committee Of The Red Cross.
